occupations.description: Ruler of a kingdom or realm, holding supreme political power and often considerable wealth and land.
Son of a king or queen, often groomed for leadership roles and granted privileges and responsibilities.
High-ranking noble who governs a duchy or territory on behalf of the monarch, with significant political influence and wealth.
Noble who oversees a county or earldom, responsible for local governance and administration.
Noble who holds a barony, typically a smaller territory or estate, with authority over local matters and land.
Noble ranking below a baron but above a knight, often entrusted with administrative duties or military commands.
Honorary title bestowed on a lesser noble or individual of high social standing, often associated with land ownership and privileges.
Honorific title granted to an individual for service, valor, or loyalty, often serving as a military commander or protector of the realm.
High-ranking official who advises nobles and rulers on matters of statecraft, policy, and governance.
Wise counselor and confidant who provides guidance and counsel to nobles and rulers on various issues and decisions.
Academic, researcher, and intellectual dedicated to the pursuit of knowledge and understanding in various fields.
Magic user who studies arcane arts and wields powerful spells, often serving as an advisor, mentor, or guardian of ancient knowledge.
Wise and knowledgeable individual respected for their insights and counsel, often consulted on matters of history, lore, or prophecy.
Scientist and experimenter who specializes in the study of alchemy, seeking to transmute substances and unlock hidden properties.
Custodian of knowledge and information, managing libraries and archives, organizing records, and aiding in research and study.
Mapmaker and geographer skilled in the art of cartography, creating maps and charts to document geography, navigation, and exploration.
Thinker and scholar who ponders the nature of existence, morality, and knowledge, seeking to understand the fundamental truths of the universe.
Observer of celestial phenomena who interprets the movements and positions of celestial bodies to make predictions and insights about human affairs.
Researcher and chronicler of past events, civilizations, and cultures, studying archives, artifacts, and written records to understand history.
Scientist specializing in the study of plants, including their classification, structure, growth patterns, and medicinal properties.
Expert in the study of religion and theology, examining beliefs, doctrines, and spiritual traditions to deepen understanding of divine matters and human spirituality.
Trader and business owner engaged in buying, selling, and transporting goods for profit, often involved in commerce and negotiations.
Skilled artisan who creates goods or provides services through manual labor and specialized techniques, valued for their craftsmanship and expertise.
Medical practitioner trained in the art of healing and caring for the sick or injured, providing essential healthcare services to communities.
Skilled craftsman or craftswoman who creates fine art, sculptures, jewelry, and decorative objects using traditional techniques and materials.
Creative thinker and tinkerer who conceives, designs, and builds new devices, gadgets, and inventions to solve practical problems or improve existing technologies.
Problem solver and builder who applies scientific principles and technical knowledge to design, construct, and maintain structures, machines, and systems.
Designer and planner who envisions and creates buildings, structures, and landscapes, balancing aesthetics, functionality, and sustainability.
Artist who creates and performs music, expressing emotions and stories through melodies, harmonies, and rhythms, entertaining audiences and enriching cultural experiences.
Performer who portrays characters and roles in theatrical productions, films, or television shows, using their talents to entertain and evoke emotions in audiences.
Worker who extracts minerals, ores, and other valuable resources from mines, caves, or quarries, contributing to the production of raw materials for various industries.
Owner and operator of a tavern, inn, or pub, providing food, drink, and lodging to travelers, adventurers, and locals, fostering community and social interaction.
Metalworker and forger who shapes and manipulates iron, steel, and other metals to create tools, weapons, armor, and decorative items through heating, hammering, and forging.
Skilled craftsman who works with wood, constructing buildings, furniture, and structures using traditional woodworking techniques and tools.
Worker who cultivates and harvests crops, raises livestock, and manages agricultural land to produce food and resources for sustenance.
Manual worker employed in various industries, construction projects, or services, performing physical tasks and labor for wages or livelihood.
Domestic worker who provides assistance, maintenance, and support to households, estates, or noble families, often performing menial tasks or duties.
Individual who engages in illegal activities, such as theft, smuggling, or violence, often operating outside the bounds of society and law.
Outlaw who roams the wilderness or preys on travelers and merchants, often forming gangs or brigands to plunder and pillage for wealth.
Trafficker and illicit trader who smuggles contraband, forbidden goods, or prohibited substances across borders or through clandestine routes for profit.
Associate of criminal organizations or gangs, involved in various illicit activities such as extortion, racketeering, and intimidation.
Mercenary and assassin hired to carry out murders, assassinations, or acts of violence for financial gain or political motives.
Skilled practitioner of theft and burglary, adept at stealth, sleight of hand, and evasion, targeting valuables and wealth for personal enrichment.
Middleman and broker who buys and sells stolen goods, concealing their origins and facilitating the disposal of illicit merchandise for profit.
